787.question: What is increase in percentage of humor contained in headlines generated with TitleStylist method (w.r.t. baselines)?
787.response:
{'Answer': 'The increase in percentage of humor contained in headlines generated with the TitleStylist method with respect to baselines is 10.7%.'} 

To explain, Image 5 presents the percentages for the most humorous headlines chosen among TitleStylist and two baselines: NHG and Multitask. The baseline NHG has a humor percentage of 18.7%, Multitask has 35.3%, and TitleStylist has 46%. The increase from the baseline NHG to TitleStylist is 46.0 - 18.7 = 27.3%, and
787.answer:
Humor in headlines (TitleStylist vs Multitask baseline):
Relevance: +6.53% (5.87 vs 5.51)
Attraction: +3.72% (8.93 vs 8.61)
Fluency: 1,98% (9.29 vs 9.11)
